title:
Merge two or more ROR records: 
 
ACT & American College Testing0339x3x34 and 05183v471
body:
Summary of request: Merge two or more ROR records

Update record:
Name of organization: ACT
ROR ID: https://ror.org/05183v471
Which part of the record needs to be changed? 
Description of change: ACT & American College Testing
ROR ID(s) of organization(s) affected by this change: 0339x3x34 and 05183v471
How should the record(s) be changed? ACT had been a common acronym for American College Testing and I think it is now their official name - https://www.act.org/ - note the URL in the ACT record was never correct so perhaps there is something else conflated with this

Update: change.status==inactive;$

Related organizations: https://ror.org/0339x3x34 (successor-np)
comments:
adambuttrick
04/20/2023, 20:03:00 | 04/20/2023, 20:03:23
comment_text: From the [Wayback Archive](https://web.archive.org/web/20190212192738/http://www.actinternationalservices.com/en/), this appears to been a subsidiary organization for ACT for their international activities. The have a new sub-domain - https://global.act.org - that covers the same ground, but I'm not really seeing this a discrete entity. Since we don't know the full history of this transition, I think the safest thing for now is to list this as inactive and point at the main ACT record (vs. withdrawing).

---

title:

CoreTrustSeal Standards & Certification Board
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: CoreTrustSeal Standards & Certification Board
Website: https://www.coretrustseal.org
Link to publications: https://www.re3data.org/search?query=CoreTrustSeal
Organization type: Nonprofit (A non-profit and non-governmental organization involved in conducting or funding research)
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: 
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Aliases: CoreTrustSeal Standards and Certification Board; CoreTrustSeal; CoreTrustSeal Board
Labels:
Acronym/abbreviation: CTS
Related organizations:
City: The Hague
Country: Netherlands
Geonames ID: 2747373
Year established: 2017
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for datasets, To acknowledge a research facility, To be integrated in a scholarly publishing system, To record certification information about trustworthy repositories

Other information about this request: Confirmation of my affiliation with CoreTrustSeal can be provided by a CC to info@coretrustseal.org on any responses.
comments:
ror-curator-bot
04/24/2023, 17:54:19 | 04/24/2023, 17:54:19
comment_text: Publication affiliation usage: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jacc.2003.12.016; https://doi.org/10.1517/13543776.10.5.575; https://doi.org/10.1016/j.bcp.2008.11.027; https://doi.org/10.1055/s-0038-1656329; https://doi.org/10.1088/1126-6708/2004/07/036; https://doi.org/10.1093/hmg/6.5.709; https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7564703; https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7564703; 
Potential aliases: CTS; CoreTrustSeal Board; CoreTrustSeal

---
adambuttrick
04/24/2023, 18:20:39 | 04/24/2023, 18:20:39
comment_text: Data repository certification organization that is a cooperative effort between the Data Seal of Approval and the [World Data System](https://www.world-data-system.org/) of the International Science Council, under the umbrella of the [Research Data Alliance](https://rd-alliance.org/) (RDA),. Request here appear to be to add [their board ](https://www.coretrustseal.org/about/standards-and-certification-board/) vs the organization writ large, I'm assuming for ORCID or similar acknowledgement. While all seems legitimate, I'm struggling to see where this would fit within any of our conceptions of a research organization, so I'd appreciate if others could weigh in.

---
